intro: Torilis helvetica, commonly known as the common hedge parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it identifiable by its delicate foliage and unique floral structure.
